intro: Toxocarpus cyclosepalus, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange corolla that resembles a bell. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
